story:
Let me transform this resume into a coherent career story:

Meet a versatile sales professional whose journey began in the hospitality industry. From 2005 to 2008, they owned and managed a 100-seat restaurant, where they learned the fundamentals of business operations, from creating business plans to building a loyal client base. Their responsibilities included everything from hiring staff to overseeing catering events and designing menus.

Seeking new challenges, they transitioned into real estate, working as a leasing consultant for various properties between 2008 and 2011. They managed communities ranging from 250 to 800 units, mastering the art of customer service, lease agreements, and property management.

In 2012, they obtained their Pennsylvania Real Estate License from Schlicker Kratz R/E Institute, which marked their entry into automotive sales. From late 2010 through 2014, they built a successful career in car sales at various dealerships. In these roles, they perfected their sales technique, focusing on customer satisfaction and relationship building. Their responsibilities included greeting customers, conducting test drives, negotiating prices, and maintaining long-term client relationships through follow-up calls and referral requests.

Their educational background includes an Associate's Degree in Office Operations Management and a Diploma in Graphics Design from Lansdale School of Business, completed in 2005 and 2003 respectively. This diverse educational foundation, combined with their varied professional experience, has created a well-rounded sales professional who understands both the operational and customer-facing aspects of business.

Throughout their career, they've consistently demonstrated strong skills in customer service, sales negotiation, business operations, and relationship building. Their journey shows a progressive evolution from business ownership to specialized sales roles, with each position building upon the skills learned in previous roles.
